concise_definition: n. 战利品, 战利品所得, 腐坏的食物

definitions.explanation_en: Goods or wealth taken by force, especially from an enemy after a victory in war; often used in the plural to refer to the benefits gained from conquest or competition.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过武力夺取的财物，尤指战争胜利后从敌人处获得的战利品；常以复数形式出现，泛指通过征服或竞争所获得的利益。
definitions.example_en: The soldiers divided the spoils of the defeated army among themselves.
definitions.example_cn: 士兵们将战败军队的战利品平分了。

definitions.explanation_en: The benefits or advantages gained from a particular activity or situation, often implying unfair or undeserved gain.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指从某种活动或情境中获得的好处或优势，常暗含不公正或不应得的收益之意。
definitions.example_en: The executives enjoyed the spoils of the company’s success while the workers saw no raise.
definitions.example_cn: 高管们享受着公司成功的红利，而员工却未获得任何加薪。

definitions.explanation_en: Food that has become spoiled or rotten, especially when referring to food that has been left unrefrigerated or past its expiration date.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指已经变质或腐烂的食物，尤指未冷藏或过期的食物。
definitions.example_en: The picnic basket contained spoils that made everyone sick after lunch.
definitions.example_cn: 野餐篮里的变质食物让所有人午餐后都生病了。

comparison.analysis: “Booty” (战利品) 与 “spoils” 在战争语境中常可互换，但 “booty” 更具口语化和文学色彩，常用于描述海盗、劫掠者获得的财宝，带有浪漫化或戏剧化的意味。而 “spoils” 更正式，涵盖范围更广，包括政治、经济竞争中的收益。
“Prize” (奖品) 指通过竞赛、比赛或合法途径赢得的奖励，强调公平性和荣誉性。而 “spoils” 通常暗示通过武力、征服或不正当手段获得，带有道德上的负面色彩。
“Rotten food” 是一个描述性短语，仅指食物腐败的状态，无引申义。而 “spoils” 作为名词时，既可指食物腐败，也可指战争或竞争中的收益，具有多重语义层次，语义更丰富且语境更复杂。
